column1: It is perfectly normal for an infant to cry when hungry, thirsty, tired, lonely, or in pain.
Always check for possible causes of pain or discomfort in a crying baby.
It is not uncommon for a hair to get wrapped around part of your baby, such as a toe, creating pain.

Call the provider if: - A baby's excessive crying remains unexplained and does not go away in 1 day, despite attempts at home treatment - The baby has other symptoms, such as fever, along with the excessive crying
